org.mobicents.slee.resource.cluster
Interface FaultTolerantTimer

All Known Implementing Classes:
FaultTolerantTimerImpl
public interface FaultTolerantTimer

A Fault Tolerant timer that resembles the ScheduledExecutorService. There are two fundamental changes in the interfaces: 1) Tasks must follow a specific interface, to ensure that the scheduler is able to replicate its data, and fail over the task if needed. 2) Cancellation of task is done through this interface, not through ScheduledFuture objects, this allows the operation to be easily done in any cluster node.

Author:
martins

            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,

Requests the cancellation of the FT Timer Task with the specified ID.

Parameters:
taskID - the ID of the timer task to cancel
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if task is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not configured.

configure

void configure(FaultTolerantTimerTaskFactory taskFactory,
               int threads)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.NullPointerException
Configures the fault tolerant timer, specifying the timer task factory and the number of threads the timer uses to execute tasks. This method may be invoked only once, and before any task is scheduled,

Parameters:
taskFactory - the timer task factory
threads - the number of threads used by the timer, to execute tasks.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is already configured.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the threads parameter is a negative number.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the task factory is null.

schedule

void schedule(FaultTolerantTimerTask task,
              long delay,
              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                     java.lang.NullPointerException
Creates and executes a one-shot action that becomes enabled after the given delay.

Parameters:
task - the task to execute
delay - the time from now to delay execution
unit - the time unit of the delay parameter
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if task is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not configured.

scheduleAtFixedRate

void scheduleAtFixedRate(FaultTolerantTimerTask task,
                         long initialDelay,
                         long period,
                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                java.lang.NullPointerException
Creates and executes a periodic action that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given period; that is executions will commence after initialDelay then initialDelay+period, then initialDelay + 2 * period, and so on. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor. If any execution of this task takes longer than its period, then subsequent executions may start late, but will not concurrently execute.

Parameters:
task - the task to execute
initialDelay - the time to delay first execution
period - the period between successive executions
unit - the time unit of the initialDelay and period parameters
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if task is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if period less than or equal to zero
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not configured.

scheduleWithFixedDelay

void scheduleWithFixedDelay(FaultTolerantTimerTask task,
                            long initialDelay,
                            long delay,
                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                   java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                   java.lang.NullPointerException
Creates and executes a periodic action that becomes enabled first after the given initial delay, and subsequently with the given delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next. If any execution of the task encounters an exception, subsequent executions are suppressed. Otherwise, the task will only terminate via cancellation or termination of the executor.

Parameters:
task - the task to execute
initialDelay - the time to delay first execution
delay - the delay between the termination of one execution and the commencement of the next
unit - the time unit of the initialDelay and delay parameters
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if task is null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if delay less than or equal to zero
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not configured.
